meanings.definition: A loud, prolonged, mournful cry or howl.
meanings.sent1: The yowl of the cat echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: I heard a yowl coming from the alley.
meanings.sent3: The yowl of the wind made the trees sway.
meanings.sent4: The yowl of the wolf pierced the silence of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The yowl of the baby kept everyone awake.

meanings.definition: To utter a loud, long, mournful cry.
meanings.sent1: The cat will yowl if it's hungry.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the dog yowl in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The wind seemed to yowl as it blew through the trees.
meanings.sent4: The engine began to yowl as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: She would yowl in frustration when things didn't go her way.
